items.title: Obama-Appointed Judge Strikes Down Trump Freeze On Harvard Grants
items.standfirst: A federal judge has ruled that the Trump administration acted unlawfully when it froze more than $2 billion in federal research funding to Harvard University. U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs, an Obama appointee, dismissed the administration’s claim that the cuts were aimed at combating…

items.title: Judge rules Trump administration's funding freeze against Harvard was unlawful
items.standfirst: The decision from U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs is a massive victory for Harvard University.
items.content: The decision from U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs is a massive victory for Harvard University.

items.title: US judge overturns Trump’s Harvard research funding freeze
items.standfirst: A US judge on Wednesday ordered the Trump administration to reverse funding cuts to Harvard University, which froze more than $2 billion. The cuts were imposed over allegations of antisemitism and bias at the Ivy League school, sparking a legal battle over federal support for higher education.
items.content: A US judge on Wednesday ordered the Trump administration to reverse funding cuts to Harvard University, which froze more than $2 billion. The cuts were imposed over allegations of antisemitism and bias at the Ivy League school, sparking a legal battle over federal support for higher education.

items.title: Trump administration illegally froze billions in Harvard funds, judge rules
items.standfirst: The ruling is a legal victory for Harvard but the White House says it will appeal the decision.
items.content: The ruling is a legal victory for Harvard but the White House says it will appeal the decision.(Image credit: Elissa Nadworny)

items.title: US judge rules Trump unlawfully cut Harvard University research grants
items.standfirst: The decision is a victory for the Ivy League university, which has been locked in a months-long feud with Trump.
items.content: The decision is a victory for the Ivy League university, which has been locked in a months-long feud with Trump.

ai_summary: A federal judge overturned the Trump administration's freeze on Harvard's research funding.
The judge, an Obama appointee, found the administration's actions unlawful.
The administration had frozen over $2 billion in federal research funding to Harvard.
The cuts were related to allegations of antisemitism and bias at the university.
The White House stated it would appeal the judge's decision regarding the funding.

clusters.title: Thursday briefing: China flexes its muscle in the tussle for global dominance
clusters.neutral_headline: China flexes its muscle in the tussle for global dominance

items.title: Thursday briefing: China flexes its muscle in the tussle for global dominance
items.standfirst: In today’s newsletter: In hosting anti-western leaders at its largest ever military parade, Beijing sent a defiant message that will be heard loud and clear across the worldGood morning. All eyes have been on China this week as the second biggest global economy flexed its muscles.Dozens of world leaders, including from the global south, authoritarian pariah states and the EU, attended China’s largest ever military parade on Wednesday to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the war of resistance against Japanese aggression.UK news | Deputy PM Angela Rayner has admitted she underpaid stamp duty on her £800,000 seaside flat, after coming under intense pressure to be more transparent about her property arrangements.Russia | Vladimir Putin has invited Kim Jong-un to visit Russia during a lengthy meeting in Beijing on the sidelines of China’s biggest military parade, as Kim promised to do “everything I can to assist” Moscow.Police | The Metropolitan police have declined to drop their investigation into the comedy writer Graham Linehan for tweets about trans issues, and said that the law used by officers to detain him needs reviewing.Israel | Israeli drones dropped four grenades near UN peacekeepers in south Lebanon, the agency’s force said on Wednesday, in what it described as “one of the most serious attacks” on its personnel since a November ceasefire.Portugal | A day of national mourning has been declared in Portugal after at least 15 people were killed when Lisbon’s well-known Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday. Continue reading...
items.content: In today’s newsletter: In hosting anti-western leaders at its largest ever military parade, Beijing sent a defiant message that will be heard loud and clear across the worldGood morning. All eyes have been on China this week as the second biggest global economy flexed its muscles.Dozens of world leaders, including from the global south, authoritarian pariah states and the EU, attended China’s largest ever military parade on Wednesday to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the war of resistance against Japanese aggression.UK news | Deputy PM Angela Rayner has admitted she underpaid stamp duty on her £800,000 seaside flat, after coming under intense pressure to be more transparent about her property arrangements.Russia | Vladimir Putin has invited Kim Jong-un to visit Russia during a lengthy meeting in Beijing on the sidelines of China’s biggest military parade, as Kim promised to do “everything I can to assist” Moscow.Police | The Metropolitan police have declined to drop their investigation into the comedy writer Graham Linehan for tweets about trans issues, and said that the law used by officers to detain him needs reviewing.Israel | Israeli drones dropped four grenades near UN peacekeepers in south Lebanon, the agency’s force said on Wednesday, in what it described as “one of the most serious attacks” on its personnel since a November ceasefire.Portugal | A day of national mourning has been declared in Portugal after at least 15 people were killed when Lisbon’s well-known Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday. Continue reading...

items.title: In a 'hot mic' moment, Xi and Putin contemplate immortality and organ transplants
items.standfirst: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin were overheard Wednesday musing about life-extending organ transplants and the possibility of immortality. The discussion was captured by state media microphones before Beijing's massive mlitary parade this week, and highlighted the leaders’ shared vision for the future against a backdrop of geopolitical tensions.
items.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin were overheard Wednesday musing about life-extending organ transplants and the possibility of immortality. The discussion was captured by state media microphones before Beijing's massive mlitary parade this week, and highlighted the leaders’ shared vision for the future against a backdrop of geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Leaders of China, Russia, North Korea appear at military parade
items.standfirst: The leaders of China, Russia and North Korea appeared at a military parade in Beijing. At one point, Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were heard on a hot mic talking about how organ transplants could lead to human immortality. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports.
items.content: The leaders of China, Russia and North Korea appeared at a military parade in Beijing. At one point, Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were heard on a hot mic talking about how organ transplants could lead to human immortality. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports.

items.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: A hot mic caught Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin talking about organ transplants and immortality as the leaders walked together on the sidelines of the military parade in Beijing.
items.content: A hot mic caught Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin talking about organ transplants and immortality as the leaders walked together on the sidelines of the military parade in Beijing.

items.title: Putin says he discussed longevity, immortality with Xi Jinping
items.standfirst: Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on a hot mic on Wednesday discussing human longevity in a brief exchange that touched on living to 150 years old and even the prospect of “immortality.” The unscripted conversation took place right before a military parade in Beijing, which marked 80 years since Japan’s surrender in World War II. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.
items.content: Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on a hot mic on Wednesday discussing human longevity in a brief exchange that touched on living to 150 years old and even the prospect of “immortality.” The unscripted conversation took place right before a military parade in Beijing, which marked 80 years since Japan’s surrender in World War II. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.

items.title: Watch: Xi and Putin discuss organ transplants and living 'indefinitely'
items.standfirst: The two leaders discussed how organ transplants could help people live to 150-years-old.
items.content: The two leaders discussed how organ transplants could help people live to 150-years-old.

items.title: Hot mic catches Xi and Putin discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: The Chinese and Russian leaders have been in power for 13 and 25 years respectively, with neither expressing any intention of stepping down.
items.content: The Chinese and Russian leaders have been in power for 13 and 25 years respectively, with neither expressing any intention of stepping down.

items.title: Xi Jinping says world faces ‘peace or war’, as Putin and Kim join him for military parade
items.standfirst: Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as rebuke to the westXi Jinping said the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held China’s largest-ever military parade, joined by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un in a show of defiance to the west.Putin and Kim, the authoritarian leaders of Russia and North Korea, were among dozens of world leaders who attended the parade, a massive display of military hardware and personnel, orchestrated to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as rebuke to the westXi Jinping said the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held China’s largest-ever military parade, joined by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un in a show of defiance to the west.Putin and Kim, the authoritarian leaders of Russia and North Korea, were among dozens of world leaders who attended the parade, a massive display of military hardware and personnel, orchestrated to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression. Continue reading...

items.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: Live footage of private conversation between Russian president and Chinese leader aired at Beijing military paradeThe authoritarian strongmen Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have mused on how organ transplants might lead to immortality, during a brief exchange of small talk caught on a hot mic at a military parade.The Russian president was in Beijing on Wednesday with the Chinese leader, who hosted allies for a ceremony to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war. Continue reading...
items.content: Live footage of private conversation between Russian president and Chinese leader aired at Beijing military paradeThe authoritarian strongmen Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have mused on how organ transplants might lead to immortality, during a brief exchange of small talk caught on a hot mic at a military parade.The Russian president was in Beijing on Wednesday with the Chinese leader, who hosted allies for a ceremony to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin hails ties with China as Kim Jong-un arrives in Beijing on eve of parade
items.standfirst: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: China hosted a large military parade attended by global leaders, including Putin.
Deputy PM Angela Rayner admitted to underpaying stamp duty on a flat.
Vladimir Putin invited Kim Jong-un to visit Russia during a meeting.
The Metropolitan police declined to drop an investigation into Graham Linehan.
Israeli drones dropped grenades near UN peacekeepers in south Lebanon.

clusters.title: Portugal holds day of mourning for 15 people killed in Lisbon funicular crash
clusters.neutral_headline: Portugal holds day of mourning for 15 people killed in Lisbon funicular crash

items.title: Portugal holds day of mourning for 15 people killed in Lisbon funicular crash
items.standfirst: Portugal declared a day of mourning on Thursday after the yellow Gloria funicular in Lisbon derailed, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 near one of the city’s busiest tourist spots. Lisbon prosecutors said they were launching an investigation into the accident's circumstances.
items.content: Portugal declared a day of mourning on Thursday after the yellow Gloria funicular in Lisbon derailed, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 near one of the city’s busiest tourist spots. Lisbon prosecutors said they were launching an investigation into the accident's circumstances.

items.title: Portugal declares day of mourning for 15 people killed in Lisbon funicular railway crash
items.standfirst: Another 18 people injured when Gloria funicular railway car derails and apparently crashed into a buildingExplainer: what is Lisbon’s funicular railway Elevador da Glória and how does it work?A day of national mourning has been declared in Portugal after at least 15 people were killed when Lisbon’s well-known Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday.An emergency services spokesperson said some foreign nationals were among the dead but would not identify the victims or disclose their nationalities. At least 18 people, including a child, were injured, five of them seriously. Continue reading...
items.content: Another 18 people injured when Gloria funicular railway car derails and apparently crashed into a buildingExplainer: what is Lisbon’s funicular railway Elevador da Glória and how does it work?A day of national mourning has been declared in Portugal after at least 15 people were killed when Lisbon’s well-known Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday.An emergency services spokesperson said some foreign nationals were among the dead but would not identify the victims or disclose their nationalities. At least 18 people, including a child, were injured, five of them seriously. Continue reading...

items.title: What we know about fatal Lisbon funicular derailment
items.standfirst: At least 15 people died after a car on Lisbon's famous funicular railway derailed and crashed.
items.content: At least 15 people died after a car on Lisbon's famous funicular railway derailed and crashed.

items.title: At least 15 people dead after streetcar derails in Lisbon
items.standfirst: At least 15 people have died and more than a dozen are injured after a popular streetcar derailed in Lisbon. The funicular that crashed, the Elevador de Gloria, runs between the Baixa and Bairro Alto neighborhoods in Lisbon. Portuguese authorities have announced an investigation into the crash, and local officials have called for three days of mourning.
items.content: At least 15 people have died and more than a dozen are injured after a popular streetcar derailed in Lisbon. The funicular that crashed, the Elevador de Gloria, runs between the Baixa and Bairro Alto neighborhoods in Lisbon. Portuguese authorities have announced an investigation into the crash, and local officials have called for three days of mourning.

items.title: At least 15 killed as funicular railcar derails in Portugal’s Lisbon
items.standfirst: Crash of the historic Elevador da Gloria funicular is one of Lisbon’s deadliest transport accidents in years.
items.content: Crash of the historic Elevador da Gloria funicular is one of Lisbon’s deadliest transport accidents in years.

items.title: At least 15 people killed and 18 injured in crash of funicular railway in Lisbon
items.standfirst: At least 15 people were killed and 18 were injured in a crash of a popular funicular railway in Lisbon, Portugal, on Wednesday, according to local authorities.
items.content: At least 15 people were killed and 18 were injured in a crash of a popular funicular railway in Lisbon, Portugal, on Wednesday, according to local authorities.

items.title: At least 15 dead after Lisbon funicular derails
items.standfirst: A Lisbon funicular derailed on Wednesday, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 others in one of the city’s busiest tourist areas, emergency services said. Images showed the iconic yellow Gloria car overturned on a steep street as firefighters and medics rushed to the scene.
items.content: A Lisbon funicular derailed on Wednesday, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 others in one of the city’s busiest tourist areas, emergency services said. Images showed the iconic yellow Gloria car overturned on a steep street as firefighters and medics rushed to the scene.

ai_summary: A funicular derailment in Lisbon killed at least fifteen people and injured eighteen.
The accident occurred near a popular tourist area in Lisbon, Portugal.
Portuguese authorities have launched an investigation into the funicular crash.
Some of the injured and deceased were foreign nationals, authorities stated.
Local officials have declared a day of mourning following the incident.

items.title: Afghanistan death toll passes 1,400 as second earthquake strikes
items.standfirst: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. clusters.neutral_headline: Kim Jong Un and his young daughter take the spotlight at China's military parade

items.title: Kim Jong Un and his young daughter take the spotlight at China's military parade
items.standfirst: Kim Jong Un was joined by his daughter Kim Ju Ae at the China military parade in Beijing, as she emerges as the likely successor in North Korea.
items.content: Kim Jong Un was joined by his daughter Kim Ju Ae at the China military parade in Beijing, as she emerges as the likely successor in North Korea.

items.title: What do we know about Kim Jong Un's daughter - and potential successor?
items.standfirst: Kim Ju Ae's visit to China with her father is likely to further fuel speculation she may succeed him.
items.content: Kim Ju Ae's visit to China with her father is likely to further fuel speculation she may succeed him.

ai_summary: Kim Jong Un and his daughter attended the China military parade.
Kim Ju Ae's presence fuels speculation about succession.
She is likely to be his successor.

clusters.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
clusters.neutral_headline: Sudan Landslide Kills Hundreds, Rebel Group Says

items.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
items.standfirst: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.
items.content: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.

items.title: Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
items.standfirst: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...
items.content: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A landslide in Sudan killed over 1,000 people.
The landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains.
Only one survivor was reported by the rebel group.
The landslide followed heavy rainfall.

clusters.title: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela

items.title: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.
items.content: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

items.title: Trump says 11 dead in strike on Venezuelan drugs boat
items.standfirst: A strike on what the US called a Venezuelan gang's drug-carrying vessel killed 11 people, Donald Trump has said.
items.content: A strike on what the US called a Venezuelan gang's drug-carrying vessel killed 11 people, Donald Trump has said.

ai_summary: Trump said a US strike killed 11 people.
The strike targeted a Venezuelan gang's drug vessel.
The Trump administration has signaled willingness to use force.
